resource.string: If there is no dolphin there are no visitors.
Allowing the man to meet with local traders will help to encourage others to visit our lands.
If we need to cull the number the best thing to do is kill them.
Send envoys to confirm the validity of his claims.
The widow seems a little too calm for one who has just lost her husband.
A pure white bull will surely see us returned to Lord Poseidon's good graces.
Those who have tasted it say the wine is the nectar of the gods! Control of such a fine thing would be profitable indeed.
Precious metals help boost trade and economy.
This man may speak in tongues but his muddled words spread fear and doubt. You must discredit him and all must see his falsehood.
Those who defend the gods should be praised for their actions, even kin-slayers.
Good winds come and go. Poseidon may simply be busy elsewhere. There is no need to do anything hasty…
Traditional demands we pit this man against one of our champions. If he is slain, the gods decree there will be war!
Spreading manure will revitalise the soil and bring a much better harvest next year.
We must send a clear message to the slaves: this kind of behaviour will not be tolerated!
The woman is unhinged by grief! She cannot be allowed to go through with this madness.
Returning this man to his masters would be a show of good faith and might avoid war.
This woman may be an none-too-subtle attempt to plant a spy in your court.
This creature is your servant. It would never dare to trick you, would it?
The magi will know how to return the land to fertility.
Our leader should go to his ancestors with all the treasures of his mortal life, and in a resting place worthy of his might.
Everyone needs a diverting hobby but, when things get out of hand, it is a matter for the family. Nobody else needs to know.
Farming and animal husbandry will provide an abundance of produce.
Everyone loves a feast! We should see our leader to his ancestors with drink, song and laughter.
Marriages between Greeks and Eastern nobles will promote cooperation and philhellenism among the elite.
He will be remembered for his great deeds, as all great men should be.
What your family members chose to do with their time is their concern, not yours.
Rejoice! Asclepios has healed this man and we must honour his good work.
These tales must be seen to be believed. You should visit the old man to see the truth for yourself.
The gods demand the blood of disloyal servants.
We must protect Egypt's heritage! The guilty must face justice.
We have no time for old blacksmiths.
Introducing wine standards will improve the quality but reduce the quantity of wine produced each year.
She is nothing to us now! Let the harlot remove herself and go where she will!
It may be wise to ignore any advances from this young woman and her masters.
This is no time to scrimp! The gods must be appeased!
It would be rude to turn away such a generous gift.
There is no proof that this man was ever lame: he is just another beggar.
Such talent should be put to better use. His current owners clearly don't appreciate him.
The gods of the forest always welcome gifts.
Only the sacrifice of a noble beast will appease such rage.
Settling additional Greek citizens within foreign territories, spreading Hellenism.
Blood is blood, after all. What's the worst the boy could do?
The gods will welcome our leader to their halls with great ceremony if we offer them his finest possessions.
Reinstating this boy will send an unfortunate message to the rest of your family.
The promise of glory, lands and titles will help draw many horsemen to your cause.
"""Remember, men: hold the line! Stand firm! We are stronger than anything that the enemy can throw at us!"""
Commissioning a statue of the great man will surely appease the people.
This grasping man seeks only to gain an audience! Who is he to bear the Pythia's words?
"""Our enemies are less than cowards, thank the gods! We will see the ground drenched in their blood!"""
It would be wise to greet them privately. They could be harbingers of doom…
The trade of exotic items will improve our trade, but it might spread strange, even dangerous, foreign ideas.
If a hag has visited these people they have obviously done something to deserve the wrath of the gods. There is nothing we can, or should, do for them now.
Send a small group of men to check if his claims are true.
The woman is highborn in her own lands and the child is a boy.
Personal greed should never come before the glory of Carthage.
We want none of this strange man and his shiny clothes! Kill him, and offer him and his wares to the gods!
A hag is a sure sign of a bad harvest! We must make an offering to the gods of the earth to prevent the hag's malice poisoning our crops.
These are simply the fancies of a man with too much time on his hands. Pay him no mind.
There are men in your pay that could solve this problem for you.
Mysterious raiders seem to have stolen the gold! Odd, then, that the Julii are richer…
Mysterious raiders seem to have stolen the gold! Odd, then, that the Junii are richer…
The gods will do what the gods will do. We have no power over them or their plans.
Romans have no qualms about enslaving our people. Let them live out their days in servitude!
You have more important matters to attend to.
We must investigate at once! Divine treasures should never fall into the hands of petty criminals!
She is just a slave; her words are worthless.
If the gods have marked this man who are we to doubt their intent?
The general has been a loyal servant, and you owe him this much.
If the man wishes to waste his time talking to a fawn that is his business.
There are more other matters to worry about.
The law is the law. Without real evidence the judgement of a magistrate should not be questioned.
No matter what the cost, we must find her and get her back.
A few harsh words will put an end to this madness.
The favour of the gods is something to be celebrated!
We should sacrifice a cow to celebrate this great news!
The squabbling of women is of little consequence.
If we save him from his current predicament, he swears he will turn over a new leaf.
This man should be praised! His diligence will only drive the slaves to work harder.
We have better ways to use our hard-won plunder! Let the general deal with this himself.
It was just a girl's dream.
The mistakes of one man cannot bring down a whole family. Let the fool do as he will.
Why get involved in the running of slaves? I'm sure the man knows his business better than we do.
The mutterings of the lesser folk are of no concern to us.
The fires smoulder as Vulcan works his war-forge!
Perhaps she really is a witch. It is the only sensible explanation.
If we send her away perhaps the ill luck will go with her. If she stays the people will kill her.
The god of war's wrath towards Rome's enemies is boundless!
The Cornelii will enjoy the love of the people after Lavish gladiatorial games are held.
Darkness has entered the world. We must make offerings to return your people to the light.
There is something strange about this man…
We must make an example of these cultists and of any who fail to give the gods of Rome the respect they deserve.
The man deserved his end. Leave his body to rot.
We have worked hard to achieve our status. Rome does not require hand-outs!
If this illness is coming, then nothing we do will stop it.
No one knows where this man has come from. How do we know if he can be trusted?
We must stop this illness entering your lands.
Investing in construction projects will make sure the family name survives for all eternity.
The gods will take their vengeance on these fools. They do not need our help.
The boy is of your blood; he must be protected at all costs.
If his body is found it could spark a war, we should bury it.
These women are little better than snakes! You must rid yourself of their poison!
The man has clearly lost his mind. How can he be trusted to lead men?
A creature as rare and beautiful as this should be given to the gods.
If we involve ourselves in this mess we will only further taint our family name.
The exploitation of mines and manufacturing will fill countless chests with valuable items.
Beautiful trinkets are always valuable but this man is not worthy of your time. Send a factor to purchase an item for your collection.
Trade, local and foreign, will fill your coffers and give you access to the bounty of foreign goods.
We cannot afford to have the tribe divided for the sake of one man's vanity!
There is something strange about the creature. It would be wise to honour it.
Who are we to judge the actions of a grieving mother?
A boy favoured by the gods will be a fine addition to the family.
This is quite disgusting! The girl must be made to see the error of her ways, both for her own good and that of the family!
"""The enemy's skills are no match for ours! We are the finest warriors the world has ever seen!"""
This man could challenge for the leadership of the tribe. He must be removed…
You cannot be held responsible for the actions of one foolish girl.
If this boy is destined for greatness he will get there himself.
It seems strange that the slaves were unwilling to talk about this man at first.
Who are we to question the true voice of the gods?
Send him back into exile! The boy is a disgrace!
The treasures will be transported back to Rome. We have nothing to fear from old women's curses!
Only the gods can tame this wayward girl!
Putting time and resources into this would be a waste. The man is easy to replace.
The boy may be a fool but he is our fool. Alas, we must pay the additional ransom.
The High Priestess claims that this is the will of the gods, but men should not be charged for their places of worship. They should be free to honour the gods.
We were all young and foolish once…
Iron improves your weapon- and armour-making capabilities.
You have more important matters to attend to.
Jupiter will give his protection to Rome and the people in this time of strife.
We cannot allow our people to carry on like this. It is only a matter of time before the gods show signs of their displeasure.
Desperate times call for desperate measures! We must sacrifice 100 bulls if we hope to restore to the god's good opinions!
She seems happy to discuss her family's secrets in public. We may be able to buy the information from her.
As long as they pay their taxes and serve their country we need not concern ourselves.
If this second beast is found to have no heart then we have undoubtedly incurred the wrath of the gods.
If you can convince the man to target only foreign trading vessels this could be quite lucrative…
All this plotting and scheming has to be stopped. You must make an example of this woman.
The games are incredibly popular! They should not be stopped because of a few old women in the Senate.
Investing in construction projects will make sure the family name survives for all eternity.
Investing in construction projects will make sure the family name survives for all eternity.
Send a member of the tribe to visit this chariotmaker. You have more important things to worry about.
What a merchant chooses to do with his time is of little concern to us.
The knowledge in these scrolls could prove valuable.
A fleet can carry the fight to distant enemies and protect our shores from invasion.
Refusing the mercenaries' demands may see them desert our cause, but you will retain your dignity.
We are beloved by the gods, we have nothing to fear from this travellers lies.
A strong infantry arm is always a good idea.
Compensating these greedy villains will maintain our strength, but at what cost?
The gods will not suffer this man to live! If we do not punish him we will surely suffer their wrath.
A boy favoured by the gods will be a fine addition to the family.
This Scythian slave is an excellent horseman.
This news warms the heart but the gods require nothing further from their loyal servants.
Working the slaves harder would increase their productivity, but it might cause unrest.
You have more important matters to consider.
Only a true sacrifice can restore fertility to our lands: construct a wicker man and burn offerings to the gods.
Our warriors have faced more fearsome foes, and who can say that these others will honour their given word?
If this boy is destined for greatness and he will gain his destiny on his own.
The land will recover in time, but the curse will burden him for the rest of his days.
There is no proof that this boy is of our blood. Send him away.
A man's honour is his concern. Let the general deal with the gosan as he sees fit.
What a merchant chooses to do with his time is of little concern to us.
Rigorous training will ensure that cavalry recruits are more effective on the battlefield.
We should sacrifice a white sheep to noble King of the Gods to thank him for his blessings.
The general is a loyal man and does not deserve to be mocked so mercilessly.
This colour speaks of power, strength and wealth. It should not be wasted on the common folk.
This boy has embarrassed you for the last time.
He is not of our tribe. Why should we risk war for the sake of one man's life?
It is unwise to question the Oracle. We should sacrifice a white sheep, just to be sure.
Old men worry too much, as old men do. Slaves would never dare to rise against us, their masters.
Publicans will help to ensure that the native population pays their dues to Rome.
These strange and exotic items will surely please the gods.
The man has clearly lost his mind. How can he be trusted to lead men?
The need for cheap labour is too important. We don't have the resources to waste.
Can these savages be trusted not to bite the hand that feeds? Leave him where he is.
The boy is strong and does appear to be his father in miniature.
She is no longer your concern. If her husband cannot control her, that is his problem.
A creature as rare and beautiful as this should be given to the gods.
Although she seems distraught it may all be an act…
You should send someone to meet the boy before you make a final decision.
Providing subsidies for the out of work will keep people happy.
Free of restrictions the man's work will improve and fetch a much higher price.
Let the boy claim what he will: it matters little.
The fleet-footed god will hasten Roman victory through decisive action.
Only the gods can tame this wayward girl!
In times such as these it is vital to establish strong alliances against common enemies.
Using these trained men in the army will see them turned against Rome's enemies, not our people.
Putting short-term restrictions on gladiator numbers will calm the fears of the Senators.
Limiting slaves in this area will create new jobs for the plebs, keeping them content.
Throw this creature from the Tarpeian Rock!
the slaves will know if anything was slipped into the man's food.
Combining our own bloodstock with these impressive stallions will improve the horses in our stables.
The rich and fragrant spices are already popular. Monopolising their trade will be incredibly profitable.
If the magistrate wants more slaves he can buy them himself.
How the man died matters little. Just find a new man for the position.
The trade of exotic items will only improve our trade.
A little investment would solve this little problem.
This strange material is soft against the skin and beautiful to behold. The people will learn to love it.
A little light flogging ought to remind them of their place.
There is a reason this knowledge was forgotten. Its discovery may anger the gods.
His men respect him, so it may be unwise to ignore his request.
A son of Mars will surely be the greatest general the world has ever known! Although, there will be those who doubt the truth of your daughter's story…
Dealing with creatures like these calls for drastic measures. Burning down the hovels around the docks will smoke out these rats out once and for all!
The soil is dry and parched, providing it with the water it needs will replenish it.
This is good news indeed, but not unexpected.
The squabbling of women is of little consequence.
Let this librarian do as he will with the dusty scrolls, It is of no concern.
Word of your daughter's indescretion has already spread like wildfire and there is little you can now do.
Send some men to flush these rats from their holes.
Lesser people may do as they wish. It does not matter in Sparta.
Such fine animals should not be wasted. They should go to the army.
By all accounts this boy will make a fine general one day.
It is in Sparta's best interests to encourage this adoption of our ways.
This young man is well regarded. It seems strange that he would do something like this…
Allowing the man to meet with local traders will help to improve our trade income.
These wines would be a mighty gift for the gods!
If this boy is destined for greatness he will achieve it himself.
Our brave warriors are more than capable of taking care of themselves.
Women squabble. It is in their nature. And this concubine has no power.
If this is the will of the gods we should not interfere.
The blood of an animal will please the gods of the forest and ensure our warriors have a successful hunt.
She must have been gripped by a brain fever. Punishing her will surely return her to her senses.
If the murderer is unhappy with fate, then have him thrown from the Tarpeian Rock instead. That should put an end to his complaints.
Your people have earned these rewards, and there is nothing more to be done.
With a little careful negotiation perhaps some of this money could find its way into our coffers…
Signs of this magnitude only appear once in a lifetime! We should celebrate!
Foreign attempts to engage with the Spartan ways have angered the Spartiate. Their well-being should come first.
It is the only sure way to end the curse. The man must be killed and the curse with him.
What a merchant chooses to do with his time is of little concern to us.
Personal greed should never come before the glory of Carthage.
The gods will have their vengeance, no matter what you do.
It is unwise to involve yourself with matters involving the evil eye.
Send him back to his enemies
Offering this man as a sacrifice would please our gods, but not his masters.
There is no proof that this boy is of our blood, send him away.
The gods will never stand for such behaviour! He must die.
Do you really want to be involved in this horrible mess?
The stupid boy brought this on himself! He deserves everything these animals do to him.
Send some men to flush these rats from their holes.
Your decisions should be final! Crucify him!
Such talent should be put to better use. His current owners clearly don't appreciate him.
Leaderless, the gang will disband and the grain will flow again.
Who are we to question the will of the gods?
Although we are favoured by the gods we should sacrifice a common white sheep to show our gratitude.
Gods be praised! We should sacrifice a bull to show our gratitude.
What a merchant chooses to do with his time is of little concern to us.
We cannot allow the women of the household to think that this behaviour will be tolerated.
Do you really want to be involved in this horrible mess?
Jupiter favours us! This calls for a celebration!
What a merchant chooses to do with his time is of little concern to us.
This man is a disgrace! He must be disowned for the good of the family.
Spreading manure will revitalise the soil and bring us a much better harvest next year.
These roads are beset by bandits. It would be easy for it to look like the treasure had been stolen, while putting it safely in the Hannonid family coffers.
Personal greed should never come before the glory of Carthage.
There is something about this woman that makes me trust her…
At that price? Don't be ridiculous! Send her away.
The gods gave us this land. Only they can aid us.
Let the old woman peddle her wares where she will! It matters little.
Offering these men clemency and a steady wage in our service may turn their expertise to more useful work.
Let fools have their latest fancies! You have more important things to worry about.
A freed slave is no answer. Killing a few will put the magistrate's mind at rest.
Allowing the man to meet with local traders will help to encourage more traders to visit our lands.
The King of the Gods be praised! We should sacrifice a cow to show our gratitude.
The wrath of the gods is terrible to behold! We must sacrifice a bull to appease them.
The people will soon grow tired of his ravings, leave him be.
A little investment would help to appease the magistrate.
This woman has disobeyed a direct order from you.
Such beauty and skill must be seen to be believed.
Such fine animals should not be wasted: they should go to our best warriors.
It's just malign gossip! This outsider seeks to spread fear and doubt! Cast him out!
The gods favours us! This calls for a celebration!
The power-mad pretenders are beaten. Democracy will be restored to Carthage!
It matters little what this woman claims, she has no proof.
If the man wants more slaves let him buy them himself!
This could be a prophetic dream, so you should speak to the magi.
For a small donation the astrologers could be persuaded to reconsider the signs.
You don't have time to worry about petty criminals!
If we hope to appease the gods we must give them a worthy sacrifice!
The smell of burning incense pleases and comforts the gods.
Such exotic items will only improve our trade prospects.
The power-hungry patrician families have failed. The glory and stability of the Roman Republic will not be challenged again!
The soft, decadent cloth is already becoming a symbol of wealth and power: monopolising the trade will be incredibly profitable.
The rich and fragrant spices are becoming popular and controlling their trade will be profitable.
There must be a way to remove her…
Phryne was simply expressing her love for the god Poseidon. Besides, her beauty was surely a gift from Aphrodite! It should be shared!
A reasonable sum will see the hetaira and her whelp gone, but for how long?
If we hope to avoid the wrath of Aphrodite we must make the proper offerings!
What a merchant chooses to do with his time is of little consequence to us.
Law-abiding slave owners will not be happy about the loss of their property.
A public funeral will be expensive, but anything less may result in riots!
Home to Troy's ruins, here men can admire ancient glories and take the waters at the renowned thermal springs.
The astrologers will be able to give you further guidance.
If this man wishes to make a public fool of himself, well, it's his business.
We cannot be expected to control the behaviour of every wanton person in the city.
This woman has no proof! Let her spout her fanciful lies.
Give the man the benefit of the doubt, but if he fails to give us the information we require, he should be tortured.
If he's so concerned, have him sell some of his own household slaves.
Failing to mark the passing of this legendary racer may end badly…
The Gauls' gods are still gods. Their wrath should be feared. They can keep their gold and the curse!
What a merchant chooses to do with his time is of little consequence to us.
Sending the boy away will appease the people. It may be too late to repair the damage that has been done…
Are we barbarians? We must let this man return to his homeland.
These base creatures will be easy to buy, and the grain supply is of the upmost importance.
If we have incurred the wrath of the gods, there is little we can do now…
She was standing up for husband! Loyalty should be rewarded!
The punishment a man metes out to his wife are his concern, not ours.
He may not be of our tribe but he is still a brother and a guest, we must protect him.
The granting of limited citizenship to foreigners, along with associated privileges and rights.
Recruiting cavalry will provide vital support to your infantry.
You could pay the woman to go back to her homeland and never return.
There may be an opportunity here: who would notice if the guardians of treasures were also removing them? For safekeeping, naturally.
You should verify these claims before making any rash decisions.
Her willingness to flaunt her indiscretion for all Rome to see is proof that she is a wanton! In her husband's absence someone must punish her.
Let him go or let him stay, it matters little.
Use your trusted diviners to contradict and discredit his lies.
Childish superstition! The treasure has been collected and is safe with a convoy bound for Carthage.
This is the work of some dark creature! We must burn it!
You cannot be held responsible for the actions of one foolish girl.
Every member of our tribe is a prize above treasure, be they brother or sister!
Rome's subjects should never doubt Roman justice or honesty.
Expanding your current mining operation will allow you to mine this rich deposit.
This is your general's personal business. He should have kept a closer watch on his wife.
This must not continue! We can not risk a slave revolt.
Send a servant to buy weapons from the old blacksmith. We can judge these the truth of these rumours when he returns.
Sending the best gladiators on a tour of arenas will improve the quality and popularity of the games.
Mortal men cannot change their destiny.
News of this must never reach Rome! Your daughter's reputation will be ruined and your family name forever tainted. Send her away somewhere to have the baby in secret.
You must remove this taint from your household before it does any harm.
News from the oracle should be heard by all.
What a merchant chooses to do with his time is of little consequence to us.
Home of the Pharaohs from times almost beyond reckoning, and to the Library of Alexandria, home of all wisdom.
The hag appeared in the stream, we must make offerings to the gods and goddesses of the rivers. Only they can protect us from her malice!
"His treatise on the art of horsemanship and horse-rearing: '""Peri Hippikes""."
Athens! Here a man can walk in the footsteps of classical heroes or study with the greatest philosophers of this age.
If we reason with the boy he will come to realise that his younger brother is the greater warrior and better choice.
What a merchant chooses to do with his time is of little consequence to us.
We do not share the Gauls' love of gold, but is foolish to allow such wealth to pass to our enemies. We should gather the gold and return home.
If these wretched traders cannot protect themselves, it's their problem.
Your people need you, this trip has lasted long enough.
The whole tribe knows that the younger brother is the better choice. No one will rally to the banners of this bitter and twisted half-man.
If merchants fear to travel through your lands your trade will suffer.
You don't have time to worry about petty criminals!
We do not have the time or money for such follies.
We should sacrifice a white sheep to noble Jupiter, to thank him for his blessings.
We cannot allow members of our family to attack Senators on the steps of the Senate! Only the gods know where this sort of behaviour might lead…
The hoard was offered to the gods. To take it would surely anger them.
This is a problem for her husband.
The anger of gods, barbarian or not, is no small matter. They can keep their gold!
It is the husband's right to punish this young man. You should not stand in his way.
The gods do not want gold offered in folly. The treasure will be collected from its watery resting place.
This is for the two men to sort out between themselves. There is no need to get involved.
This news warms the heart, but Jupiter requires nothing further from his loyal servants.
These base creatures will be easy to buy, and the grain supply is of the utmost importance.
An item as fine as this should be given to the gods.
The gods have clearly marked this boy as their own.
We should not anger gods and spirits, my lord. The gold was offered to them and should not be disturbed.
These people have offended the gods! The gods will want to punish them accordingly.
Combining the blood of our own horses with Nisean stallions will enrich our breeding stock.
It would please our gods to see the treasure back in Greek hands! We have nothing to fear from the barbarian gods and curses!
Your time is far too precious to waste on the trifling affairs of lesser men.
A feast for the gods will restore their favour! We must sacrifice 100 bulls!
If Chalcon has time to wander at his leisure that's wonderful for him, but we have more important matters to attend.
The virtue of rural life and agrarian wisdom.
Death will surely see the man silenced, although he is always surrounded by gladiators…
"This man is wealthy and influential. He may be willing to ""thank"" you quite adequately for this mercy."
Let him do as he will, the word of a lowly lanista means nothing to those who matter.
The morality and practice of slavery.
The virtuous Julii think the gold be best serves the Republic. The convoy finished its journey.
This is surely the work of the gods! We must make offerings to appease their anger.
"It would be remiss of us not to inform the boy's family, I'm sure they will be very ""grateful""."
These roads are beset by bandits. It would be easy for it to look like the treasure had been stolen, while putting it safely in the Magonid family coffers.
The soft, decadent cloth is already becoming a symbol of wealth and power: monopolising the trade will be incredibly profitable.
A strong, clear message must be sent.
The trade of exotic items will only improve our trade.
This man is clearly using his knowledge of the human body to bewitch the girl's mind! He must be stopped.
Hiring additional mercenaries will bolster your numbers but they may prove expensive.
The virtuous Junii think the gold be best serves the Republic. The convoy finished its journey.
Idle gossip is of little consequence.
Aphrodite will not be pleased that a woman with her gift of beauty has been so brutally murdered! We must make an example of these women!
Marrying her to a man of good standing will surely calm her wild ways. It will also take her off your hands!
The squabbling of women and the unfortunate outcome are of no concern to us.
The soil is dry and parched. Providing the water it needs will replenish the land.
What is this madness? The idea alone is laughable but when you consider the cost… Send this fool away.
Honour demands that the gosan pay the ultimate penalty for his insults.
Personal greed should never come before the glory of Carthage.
She must be punished! If we fail to make an example of this woman we risk the wrath of the gods.
If the woman is never seen again people will soon forget her lies.
Let the traders do as they will.
The child is still of your blood. Surely that counts for something?
"A reasonable sum will see this ""problem"" disappear…"
The income gained from the Nisean horse trade is too great to set aside.
Fields do not tend themselves! We must get the people back to work.
The intrigues of others are beneath you, leave the woman be.
Confront the general and show him that his behaviour is laughable.
What nonsense! Send this fraud away!
It would be unwise to involve yourself in these mercantile matters.
These are simply the fancies of a man with too much time on his hands. Pay him no mind.
Military advances will provide you with the upper hand when waging war and allow you to protect your lands from invasion.
If the people have no one to follow they will quickly return to the fields.
We can't be sure which god we have angered, we should appease all of them!
What would a slave do with money? The quickest way to find out what she knows is to take her prisoner.
I've heard that large 'donations' have been know to solve problems such as these…
The people will not be happy. Who will tend their fields and clean their homes?
Our cavalry is feared and admired, but how long will this last if every leader can breed their own herd from Nisean stallions?
If we have incurred the wrath of the gods, there is little we can do now…
Despite her unforgivable actions this woman is of your family.
This man has been stealing from Roman ships as well as foreign traders. He must be punished.
What simple fisherfolk get up to of an evening is no concern of yours…
We must get everything he knows from him: torture is the only way.
With all these people arriving we should charge them to view the boy and his pet.
The association of your gods with the foreigners' deities, by common identities, themes and aspects.
We must trust the astronomers! They are all learned men.
Let this madman do as he will.
This nonsense will surely come to an end in time.
Carthage will be a great Empire again, securing Punic hegemony over the known world!
Forcing your superior culture on lesser peoples through repression and violence.
There is little we can do now.
It may prove costly, but the people will enjoy the spectacle.
He is of your blood. And surely punishing him will appease the gods?
Young warriors with a lust for glory should be unleashed to hunt these Roman wolves!
Magnates will help reinforce local trade endeavours and development.
She must be taught a lesson! This cannot happen again!
Who are we to question the state of these lands?
Tax relief is a simple, and unprofitable, way of winning the love of your people.
Land owners will help to establish and maintain local agriculture and production.
There is always a chance that additional soldiers may be needed in future, but your own troops are more cost effective than mercenaries.
There is none more accursed than a kin-slayer! Murder is murder, even when it is done in the name of the gods.
Both of these slaves would be a worthy addition to any household.
The trade of exotic items will only improve our wealth!
Do nothing to stop the rumours
A tour of the furthest reaches of your territories is a fine way to mark the end of this man's glorious career. It will also please the people and help to spread Roman culture.
This is a matter for their father, let him do as he will with his remaining son.
This is the idle gossip of farmers and fishermen, nothing more.
There is money to be made from this strange substance.
Why should we worry about the money troubles of others?
The gods have clearly marked this boy as their own.
This slave is an excellent orator, fluent in several tongues.
The woman had cause, and killed him honestly. The head is hers by right.
Every hunter needs weapons: perhaps an offering would turn the Hunt from our doors.
This man has earned his freedom.
Only a true sacrifice will convince Lord Poseidon of our devotion. A child must be chosen from your own family, it is the only way…
Saving a man's life can make him very grateful… I'm sure he could be persuaded to share some of his new found wealth with you.
The safest course of action is to let the gods take their own vengeance.
Let this man's lanista do as he pleases.
Sacrifice one of each sacred animal
A crime of this magnitude warrants a serious punishment. This man is a thief and a murderer: crucify him.
The gods must have their revenge! Accursed be the might of Rome!
Gold given as sacrifice should not be disturbed. The gods must keep their treasure!
There is something strange about the creature. It would be wise to honour it.
Her person is sacrosanct, we have no right to kill her. She must be entombed, and the gods will do the rest.
The need for revenge is powerful and all consuming. This woman will never stop until she has avenged her husband.
The boy is strong and does seem to favour his father.
The blood of a mare will feed the earth and restore its fertility.
Visiting the man personally would be a sign of your respect for him and his art.
It would be impossible to offer this man a position, but perhaps he will settle for money instead.
Rome will be an Empire, led by the greatest patrician families, ruling gloriously over the known world!
These are simply the fancies of a man with too much time on his hands. Pay him no mind.
The Hunt is seeking souls. Perhaps, perhaps... animal blood will placate them.
We should show our gratitude for these blessings.
You cannot be held accountable for the actions of a grieving widow. There is no need to get involved.
A chariot is a chariot: the tribe has more than enough of them.
Let the boy claim what he will. What does it matter?
We have angered the gods, and now there is nothing we can do now.
The people will not be happy. Who will tend their fields and clean their homes?
Working the slaves harder would increase their productivity, but it might cause unrest.
We have no control over the Hunt. It rides where it will.
We must make offerings if we are to return the land to fertility.
The philosophy of community, including everything from household to city-state.
If the man wants more slaves let him buy them himself!
The virtuous Claudii think the gold be best serves the Republic. The convoy finished its journey.
Impossible! They must have misread the signs, for even great men make mistakes.
A little investment would help to appease the magistrate.
The quality of wine is a problem for merchants, let them deal with it.
Work the slaves harder! That should compensate for their lack of numbers.
They will never let her go; she must be found and silenced.
The people may come to accept your rule with time, but their discontent may turn into full-blown rebellion.
The child's taint is already in the land and there in nothing we can do now.
The importance of education and the advancement of society and ideas.
She cannot be allowed to stain the family honour for a moment longer…
More security will increase repression and give you more time to deal with the unrest.
Civic developments and infrastructure will allow you to further public interests but still support military endeavours.
No son wants their father to know of their failures. He will pay handsomely for our silence.
Let these merchants protect their own! You cannot be held responsible for the actions of bandits.
We have no right to decide her fate. The gods will decide her punishment.
Such a gifted boy should serve the gods.
If word of this gets out your family name will be ruined. It's gone too far and you can't protect him.
A little persuasion will put a portion of the governor's ill-gotten wealth put to good use.
It's only right that we should warn others about this boy's lack of character.
Free of restrictions the man's work will improve and fetch a much higher price.
A freed slave is no answer. Killing a few will put the magistrate's mind at rest.
These mighty warriors would be a welcome addition to Rome's auxilia.
This is the act of a mad woman! She should have been proud to offer her child to the gods! She should be confined.
Can these savages be trusted not to bite the hand that feeds? Leave him where he is.
If we give in to these animals they will only demand more money.
Roman entrepreneurs could be given permission to use the best gladiators to endorse their goods.
If the man wishes to gather his military intelligence from the creatures of the forest then… that is his business.
The revenue brought in by this man's battles is too great to cast aside! He has a few more years in him yet!
Mysterious raiders seem to have stolen the gold! Odd, then, that the Claudii are richer…
We have worked hard to achieve our status. Rome does not require hand-outs!
We have worked hard to achieve our status. Rome does not require hand-outs!
Negotiating with the mercenary captains may make them see reason.
A caravan is prepared, my lord. It will take many moons to reach the capital.
Hunting the scum down would bring the matter to a swift conclusion.
Proof of the existence of griffins will keep your gold and precious jewels safe from thieves. It may also draw curious visitors to your lands.
She is his wife. He is free to do as he choses with her.
The Julii will enjoy the love of the people after Lavish gladiatorial games are held.
The Junii will enjoy the love of the people after Lavish gladiatorial games are held.
The wishes of the gods are a mystery, but why risk waking a dark curse?
The cost of dealing with these creatures is considerable…
Let this man claim what he will, you have no time for such follies.
This shame can only be washed away with blood.
